title: Calories in 1 Cherry with Pit
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cherry with pit, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and more from our nutrition breakdown.
assumptions: Fresh sweet cherry (e.g., Bing variety), average size (~8 g total with pit), nutrition for edible flesh only; pit discarded.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, ripeness, size, and growing conditions. Check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One cherry with pit provides about 4 kcal, mostly from natural sugars.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Tart cherry variety (e.g., Montmorency) instead of sweet
Larger cherry (10 g edible vs. 6 g average)
Pitted and frozen (minimal change, but slight water loss)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cherry with pit?
faqs.a: About 4 kcal for the edible portion of one average sweet cherry.

faqs.q: Does the pit affect cherry calories?
faqs.a: No, the pit is not eaten; calories are based on the flesh only.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one cherry?
faqs.a: Approximately 0.9 g carbs, including 0.2 g fiber and 0.7 g sugars.

faqs.q: Are cherries low in fat and protein?
faqs.a: Yes, negligible fat (0 g) and very low protein (0.1 g) per cherry.

faqs.q: How does cherry size impact calories?
faqs.a: Smaller cherries have fewer calories; larger ones up to 6-8 kcal each.
